column1: Twentynine Palms (also known as 29 Palms) is a city in San Bernardino County
column2: California. It was previously called Twenty-Nine Palms. Twentynine Palms serves as one of the entry/exit points of Joshua Tree National Park.

column1: Twentynine Palms was named for the palm trees found there in 1852 by Col. Henry Washington while surveying the San Bernardino base line. A post office was established in 1927.A road named Utah Trail honors the late 1800s pioneers on a trail originating in Utah (reportedly Saint George) that went to Twentynine Palms.Nearby is a small Indian reservation belonging to the Twenty-Nine Palms Band of Mission Indians.

column4: and became a national park in 1994. The nearby Marine Corps Air Ground Combat Center Twentynine Palms was founded in 1952.

column1: The city is located in the Mojave Desert in Southern California. It lies on the northern side of the Joshua Tree National Park and includes one of the entrances to the park
column2: at the Oasis of Mara.

column3: all land. The city is at an elevation of 1
column4: 988 feet (606 m). The Marine Corps Air Ground Combat Center Twentynine Palms is located there.

column1: The city uses a council-manager form of government. An elected city council establishes policy and appoints a city manager who executes these policies.
